page.title: 02VILLAGES:HOUSING
page.content: Wellbank and Newbigging are the two villages in the area. They are so similar in size and composition that both can be described together. The housing is a mixture of council and private, in a ratio of roughly 1:1. The Newbigging council houses have been recently renovated and those in Wellbank are due for rnovation, both having been built in WWII. Occupiers of council houses tend to be either retired or manual workers. Many of the retired occupiers have been in residence since the houses were built, which reflects the area's traditional, conservative lifestyle. It also reflects that mechanisation has meant that fewer workers are needed locally. There is no pressure, generated by a changing workforce, for local housing, and so many retired couples have settled permanently.
